Executive Order Mandates Merit-Based University Admissions

Overview: This executive order prohibits universities from considering race, sex, or other protected characteristics in admissions decisions. It requires admissions to be based solely on academic qualifications and achievements.

Bottom Line: Universities must overhaul admissions to remove consideration of race and other factors.

Key Impacts on Higher Education:

Admissions policies: Must be revised to focus only on academic criteria

Application materials: Must remove questions related to race and protected characteristics

Training: Admissions staff and committees must be retrained on new merit-based evaluation process

Important Dates:

  • 08/01/2025: Revised admissions policies due to Dept of Education
  • 01/01/2026: All admissions decisions must use merit-based criteria

Affected Departments:

Admissions, Enrollment Management, Diversity & Inclusion, Legal Affairs

Action Plan:

Action Required: Yes - this order requires significant changes to admissions practices.

Immediate Steps (0-30 days):

  • Notify key stakeholders and form implementation committee
  • Inventory current use of race/characteristics in admissions
  • Seek legal guidance on how to comply with order

Short-term Actions (1-3 months):

  • Revise admissions policies, procedures, materials
  • Train all admissions staff and committees on changes

Long-term Considerations:

  • Monitor impact on diversity of applicant pool and enrolled class
  • Consider legal challenges if disparate impact occurs

Resource Requirements:

Personnel: Significant time from admissions and legal staff

Budget: Potential for increased application processing and recruitment costs

Technology: May need to modify admissions IT systems

External Expertise: Legal counsel to ensure compliance
